question_stem.en: A 23-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to a sensation of food being stuck in his throat. His symptoms started 2 hours ago after eating fish at a local seafood restaurant. He has tried swallowing many times in an attempt to clear the food but has had no relief. The patient has no difficulty with breathing. He does not appear to be in significant distress on physical examination. Laryngoscopy reveals a fish bone lodged in the left piriform recess. During retrieval of the fish bone, a nerve deep to the mucosa overlying the recess is damaged. {{exhibit_1}}
question_stem.zh: 一名23岁男性因感觉食物卡在喉咙里来到急诊科。他的症状在2小时前于当地一家海鲜餐厅吃鱼后开始出现。他曾多次尝试吞咽以试图清除食物，但未见缓解。患者呼吸无困难。体格检查未见明显不适。喉镜检查显示左侧梨状隐窝内卡有鱼刺。在取出鱼刺的过程中，覆盖隐窝的粘膜深层的一根神经受损。{{exhibit_1}}

question.en: Which of the following is most likely to be impaired in this patient as a result of his iatrogenic injury?
question.zh: 由于医源性损伤，该患者最有可能受损的是以下哪一项？

explanation.en:
The piriform recesses are small cavities that lie on either side of the laryngeal orifice. They are bounded medially by the aryepiglottic folds and laterally by the thyroid cartilage and thyrohyoid membrane. During normal swallowing, food is diverted by the epiglottis laterally through the piriform recesses into the esophagus without endangering the airway.

A thin layer of mucosa overlying the piriform recess is all that protects the superficially coursing internal laryngeal nerve, a branch of the superior laryngeal nerve (part of the vagus nerve [CN X]). Unlike the recurrent and external laryngeal nerves that carry motor fibers to the muscles involved in vocal cord function, the internal laryngeal nerve contains only sensory and autonomic fibers. It mediates the afferent limb of the cough reflex by carrying sensation from the mucosa superior to the vocal cords. {{exhibit_2}}

Damage to the internal laryngeal nerve can occur when foreign bodies (eg, chicken or fish bones) become lodged in the piriform recess or during attempts to retrieve them. The resulting reduction in laryngeal sensation can impair the cough reflex.

(Choice B) The afferent limb of the gag reflex is mediated predominantly by the glossopharyngeal nerve (CN IX), whereas the efferent limb is carried by the vagus nerve (CN X). Although the internal laryngeal nerve is a branch of CN X, it does not carry motor fibers and is not involved in the gag reflex.

(Choice C) The muscles of mastication are innervated by the mandibular branch of the trigeminal nerve (CN V3). This nerve is involved in the jaw jerk reflex, which is typically prominent only in patients with upper motor neuron lesions.

(Choice D) Salivation is mediated by the glossopharyngeal nerve (which innervates the parotid gland via the otic ganglion) and the facial nerve (which innervates submandibular and sublingual glands via the submandibular ganglion). These nerves do not lie in close proximity to the piriform recess.

(Choice E) Although the internal laryngeal nerve carries taste sensation from the root of the tongue and epiglottis, its role in the perception of taste is extremely minor. Taste sensation is primarily mediated by glossopharyngeal nerve (posterior one-third of the tongue and oropharynx) and facial nerve (anterior two-thirds of tongue).

Educational objective:
The internal laryngeal nerve mediates the afferent limb of the cough reflex above the vocal cords. Foreign bodies (eg, fish bones) can become lodged in the piriform recess and may cause damage to the nerve, impairing the cough reflex. {{exhibit_3}} {{exhibit_4}} {{exhibit_5}} {{exhibit_6}} {{exhibit_7}}
explanation.zh:
梨状隐窝是位于喉口两侧的小腔。它们内侧与杓会厌襞相接，外侧与甲状软骨和甲状舌骨膜相接。在正常吞咽过程中，食物被会厌转移至侧方，通过梨状隐窝进入食道，而不会危及气道。

覆盖梨状隐窝的薄层粘膜是保护浅表走行喉上神经（迷走神经[CN X]的一个分支）的全部。与携带运动纤维至参与声带功能的肌肉的喉返神经和喉外侧神经不同，喉上神经仅包含感觉和自主神经纤维。它通过从声带上方的粘膜传递感觉来介导咳嗽反射的传入支。{{exhibit_2}}

当异物（例如鸡骨或鱼刺）滞留在梨状隐窝中或在试图取出它们的过程中，可能发生喉上神经损伤。由此导致的喉部感觉降低会损害咳嗽反射。

(选项 B) 呕吐反射的传入支主要由舌咽神经（CN IX）介导，而传出支由迷走神经（CN X）携带。虽然喉上神经是CN X的一个分支，但它不携带运动纤维，也不参与呕吐反射。

(选项 C) 咀嚼肌由三叉神经的下颌支（CN V3）支配。该神经参与下颌反射，通常仅在上运动神经元病变患者中明显。

(选项 D) 唾液分泌由舌咽神经（通过耳神经节支配腮腺）和面神经（通过下颌下神经节支配下颌下腺和舌下腺）介导。这些神经不在梨状隐窝附近。

(选项 E) 虽然喉上神经从舌根和会厌携带味觉，但它在味觉感知中的作用非常小。味觉主要由舌咽神经（舌后三分之一和口咽）和面神经（舌前三分之二）介导。

教育目标：
喉上神经介导声带上方的咳嗽反射的传入支。异物（例如鱼刺）可能滞留在梨状隐窝中并可能导致神经损伤，从而损害咳嗽反射。{{exhibit_3}} {{exhibit_4}} {{exhibit_5}} {{exhibit_6}} {{exhibit_7}}

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of the anatomy of the piriform recess and the function of the internal laryngeal nerve, specifically its role in the afferent limb of the cough reflex. It also tests the ability to correlate anatomical location of injury with resulting neurological deficits.

To solve this question, identify the anatomical location of the injury (piriform recess) and recall the nerve that runs superficially in this area (internal laryngeal nerve). Then, remember the function of the internal laryngeal nerve (afferent limb of the cough reflex) to determine the most likely impaired function.
summary.zh:
此题考察对梨状隐窝的解剖学知识和喉上神经的功能，特别是其在咳嗽反射传入支中的作用。同时也考察了将损伤的解剖位置与由此产生的神经功能缺损相关联的能力。

要解决这个问题，确定损伤的解剖位置（梨状隐窝），并回忆在该区域浅表走行的神经（喉上神经）。然后，记住喉上神经的功能（咳嗽反射的传入支），以确定最可能受损的功能。
